main event: Bright spherical object observed changing shape from oval to cylindrical and becoming brighter in the sky over Cambria, California on December 30, 1962.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about the size of a basketball or one-third the size of the moon.
The main object was extremely luminous, white or silver in color, and had a serrated border with dark spots or holes throughout, including one distinct large hole.

The object was surrounded by a green field extending about one diameter of the sphere in all directions, and a red-colored emission was distinctly separated from the main sphere, extending upwards at an angle of 45 degrees.
The object was observed by multiple civilian witnesses, including a nurseryman, a guide at Hearst Castle, and a commercial photographer, who were considered reliable persons in the community.
The object was observed for over 2 hours and 35 minutes, from night darkness to dawn, and faded from view as daylight and sunshine appeared, but the observers believed it did not actually disappear.
